alert.note: Alert for Central Yampa River Basin; Lower Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 3:54PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Moffat County through 430 PM MDT... At 354 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 38 miles northeast of Dinosaur, or 50 miles west of Craig, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Moffat County, including the following locations... Greystone, Maybell and Sunbeam. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 51 and 61. Colorado 318 between mile markers 27 and 60. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Yampa River Basin; Lower Yampa River Basin
